studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.2.1.2.1 - Immune-Related Events and Dose Modification
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated dose modification and toxicity management guidelines for immune-related adverse events (irAEs) to harmonize with FDA-approved PD-1/L1 prescribing information.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.11 - Clinical Criteria for Early Trial Termination
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated criteria to allow for flexibility in terminating the study before the planned completion date.
Clarified that licensed COVID-19 vaccines are permitted during the study.
Minor editorial changes for clarity and alignment of informed consent language with legal requirements.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Requested by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to harmonize safety information across all FDA-approved PD-1/L1 antibody prescribing information.
To clarify the concomitant use of COVID-19 vaccines.
To add flexibility to allow the study to terminate before the planned completion date.
To align text with legal requirements to obtain informed consent.

studyChanges.afterText: Updated dose modification and toxicity management guidelines and table for irAEs.
studyChanges.summary: Revised irAE management table to align with standardized FDA safety language for PD-1 inhibitors.

studyChanges.afterText: Any COVID-19 vaccine that is licensed in a given country is allowed in the study.
studyChanges.summary: Explicitly permitted the use of licensed COVID-19 vaccines as concomitant medication.

studyChanges.afterText: Upon study completion, subjects may be enrolled in a pembrolizumab extension study, if available.
studyChanges.summary: Added provision for subjects to transition to an extension study after trial completion.

studyChanges.afterText: If subjects are rerandomized, each subject will retain his/her original treatment/randomization number.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified subject identification procedures for potential enrollment in extension studies.
